data.title: Interference
data.solution:
jumbled = input()
interference = input()

message = ""
while jumbled:
    index = jumbled.find(interference[0])
    if index < 0:
        message += jumbled
        jumbled = ""
    else:
        message += jumbled[:index]
        jumbled = jumbled[index + 1:]

    interference = interference[1:] + interference[0]

print(message)
data.statement:
Oh no, a repeating message is interfering with the message your friend is trying to send to you! Given the jumbled message [[jumbled]], and the repeating message [[interference]], you need to recover the original message.

In order to recover the original message, you must remove the interference from the jumbled message, by exploring the jumbled message and removing character by character in the interference from the jumbled message, in order, until there is no more characters to read.

For example, say your jumbled message is {{xxxabxxcxxdeaxbx}}, and your interference is {{abcde}}. In this case:

* We try to find {{a}} in {{xxxabxxcxxdeaxbx}}; it exists, so we take the message up to it ({{xxx}}) and discard the {{a}}.
* We try to find {{b}} in {{bxxcxxdeaxbx}}; it exists and is at the start, so we only discard the {{b}}.
* We try to find {{c}} in {{xxcxxdeaxbx}}; it exists, so we take the message up to it ({{xx}}) and discard the {{c}}.
* We try to find {{d}} in {{xxdeaxbx}}; it exists, so we take the message up to it ({{xx}}) and discard the {{d}}.
* We try to find {{e}} in {{eaxbx}}; it exists and is at the start, so we only discard the {{e}}.
* We try to find {{a}} in {{axbx}}; it exists and is at the start, so we only discard the {{a}}.
* We try to find {{b}} in {{xbx}}; it exists, so we take the message up to it ({{x}}) and discard the {{b}}.
* We try to find {{c}} in {{x}}; it does not exist, so we take the rest of the message and quit the loop.
* At the end, we obtain the original message, which is {{xxxxxxxxx}}.

Note that out-of-order characters must be kept. For example, if your jumbled message is {{bac}} and your interference is {{abc}}, the {{b}} and {{c}} are not in sequence for the interference, and are thus part of the original message, so the program should give an original message of {{bc}}.

testCases.title: 2-character interference with no intersection
testCases.testIn:
gI ampg pfigne, pgpgwhapt agboupt ygou?p
gp
testCases.testOut: I am fine, what about you?

testCases.title: Incomplete interference
testCases.testIn:
kgDon't forgebkt to finigsh everythinbg bkefore sgleeping!
kgb
testCases.testOut: Don't forget to finish everything before sleeping!

testCases.title: Interference with repeating characters
testCases.testIn:
Rxxepeadxting inxterfedrexnxce andxdxd chaxxracdtersx? Oh nox!
xxd
testCases.testOut: Repeating interference and characters? Oh no!

testCases.title: 10-character interference
testCases.testIn:
Wow, now this is aaab bcbcig intddaaeaarfberence. Hbow ccarde you ddaoaaaing wbbccitdh this?!
aabbccddaa
testCases.testOut: Wow, now this is a big interference. How are you doing with this?!

testCases.title: 10-character interference
testCases.testIn:
Clearxjxjvdv bldue oxxocjxejvan,d vdas soomxxe pejxjoplevdv sadoy.
xjxjvdvdox
testCases.testOut: Clear blue ocean, as some people say.

data.stubGenerator:
read jumbled:string(256)
read interference:string(10)
write answer
data.inputDescription:
<<First line:>> Jumbled message [[jumbled]].
<<Second line:>> Repeating message [[interference]].

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Oh no, a repeating message is interfering with the message your friend is trying to send to you! Given the jumbled message jumbled, and the repeating message interference, you need to recover the original message.

In order to recover the original message, you must remove the interference from the jumbled message, by exploring the jumbled message and removing character by character in the interference from the jumbled message, in order, until there is no more characters to read.

For example, say your jumbled message is xxxabxxcxxdeaxbx, and your interference is abcde. In this case:

* We try to find a in xxxabxxcxxdeaxbx; it exists, so we take the message up to it (xxx) and discard the a.
* We try to find b in bxxcxxdeaxbx; it exists and is at the start, so we only discard the b.
* We try to find c in xxcxxdeaxbx; it exists, so we take the message up to it (xx) and discard the c.
* We try to find d in xxdeaxbx; it exists, so we take the message up to it (xx) and discard the d.
* We try to find e in eaxbx; it exists and is at the start, so we only discard the e.
* We try to find a in axbx; it exists and is at the start, so we only discard the a.
* We try to find b in xbx; it exists, so we take the message up to it (x) and discard the b.
* We try to find c in x; it does not exist, so we take the rest of the message and quit the loop.
* At the end, we obtain the original message, which is xxxxxxxxx.

Note that out-of-order characters must be kept. For example, if your jumbled message is bac and your interference is abc, the b and c are not in sequence for the interference, and are thus part of the original message, so the program should give an original message of bc.
Input
First line: Jumbled message jumbled.
Second line: Repeating message interference.
Output
First line: Original message.
Constraints
1 <= length(jumbled) <= 256
1 <= length(interference) <= 10
Example
Input
iHeiillioii iwiiorliid!i
i
Output
Hello world!
